summary: Just found out about Shueisha's Manga Plus app and gave it a try and I think everyone who's into Jump stuff should definitely...
body:
Just found out about Shueisha’s Manga Plus app and gave it a try and I think everyone who’s into Jump stuff should definitely check it out!

It might even be a good place to check out Jump stuff if you’re not into it.

As they advertised, it has some of the first chapters and some of the latest chapters of series from various Jump (Shueisha) magazines (Shounen Jump, V-Jump etc) for free and with professional translation and great quality scans.

This is perfect for keeping up with a series you’re caught up with.

It is basically available everywhere, too, except China and South Korea, apparently. So, especially if your country doesn’t have much in the way of manga available, this should be great!

summary: Random BNHA headcanons (1 - Aizawa, Yamada, Kayama and Iida, cause we don’t talk about them enough)
body:
Random BNHA headcanons (1 - Aizawa, Yamada, Kayama and Iida, cause we don’t talk about them enough)

  • Aizawa Shouta (Eraserhead), Yamada Hizashi (Present Mic), Kayama Nemuri (Midnight) and Iida Tensei (Ingenium) went to the same class in U.A (eventually)
  • Hizashi and Tensei got in through the entrance exam, obviously, but Nemuri and Shouta were transferred from Gen Ed.
  • Shouta won first place in his first year Sports Festival, and was transferred after the summer break. He became a legend among the hero course rejects of Gen Ed.
  • Nemuri approached him in the middle of the year, saying he became kind of a legend, and asking him for tips on maximising her chances to transfer.
  • He tells her that relying just on her quirk is stupid and she should give herself more options.
  • Second year begins, and she’s in the hero course. (If asked, Shouta will deny that he landed her all of his class notes so she can catch up).
  • Tensei was class representative. He was a cool guy, easy to talk with, and everyone liked him.
  • That’s why everyone was surprised that he mainly hung out with the loud and excitable dork, trash bag transfer boy, and sass queen (though she was more understandable to them).
  • To be honest, they were also surprised about Tensei hanging out with them.
  • Tensei and Nemuri dated for a few months. They were the class’ most popular couple. They broke up a few months later and stayed great friends.
  • Nemuri will NOT let Tensei forget it.
  • The only reason Tenya doesn’t know about it from her is because Tensei threatened to show him pictures of her in high school. Not the good school pictures she got ready for. The really shitty pictures they took with horrible faces after three all-nighters in a row.
  • Speaking of Tenya, the group would babysit him a lot when they were in school. They did it less once they actually became pros , but Tenya still wonders why Aizawa sensei looked so familiar to him the first time he walked into class.
  • During the third year pairs of students are sent on patrols (not only in the internship program, but also as a school project, under their teachers and unrelated to outside work experience). Shouta patrolled with Hizashi, and Tensei patrolled with Nemuri.
  • Tensei has a gas mask installed in his suit so he can patrol with Nemuri and allow her to use her quirk affectivly.
  • Shouta and Hizashi patrolling together was the funniest thing ever cause Hizashi is all strolling down on the street, high fiving random civilians, and Shouta just,,, does parkour,,, trying to stay unseen,,, falling into a dumpster more times than he’d like to admit when he didn’t calculate the jump right,,,
  • Tensei (being the fastest) helped Shouta train on catching moving targets with his capture weapon.
  • When Tensei is in the hospital after the Stain incident, the entire team comes to visit him (usually separately).
  • Hizashi visits the least. Three-jobs-Yamada can’t catch a break. He’s an English teacher, a radio host, and a pro hero all at the same time. Even so, he calls whenever he can, sends little stuff with the others, and dedicates him songs on his radio show (they’re either Tensei’s favourites, songs that only mean something to their little group, songs they loved hating as teenagers or songs Tensei absolutely hates but Hizashi keeps trying to convince him to listen to).
  • Shouta’s visits are almost always unofficial. He hardly ever makes it on visitation hours, but the patient (and his family) approves of those unconventional visits, and the overworked night shift staff likes him (he always has something to eat/drink in his sleeping bag and he would share it with anyone, be it the doctors or the maintenance staff, out of tired solidarity), so they can turn a blind eye. After all, underground heroes work very hard.
  • Nemuri is the only one whose visiting schedule is normal I swear to god that woman is the only adjusted adult among them. She always has a funny story to tell him about her students or about her fans.
  • All three of them keep him distracted and don’t fuss too much around him. He appreciates it. His little brother looks so scared and heartbroken when he visits, and his mother is always worried. It’s nice to catch a break and laugh at something silly with his friends.
  • When he’s released, Tensei gets kinda bored. It’s great to be back home and all, but there isn’t much to do (especially with Tenya off at the dorms), and his parents won’t stop treating him like he’s fragile, both emotionally and physically. It really gets on his nerves, and he can’t actually escape it.
  • He does have an awesome wheelchair, and he tweaked with it a little (with some more professional help from a certain support technician he met in his earlier years and whose daughter totally played Tenya in the sports festival) so now it can go really fucking fast.
  • Eventually he decides the best place for him to be, where he can still be helpful to society with his experience even without being an active hero, is U.A. He asks Nedzu for a job as a substitute teacher.
  • He gets the job, both because Yamada Hizashi SERIOUSLY looks like he would pass out/get caffeine poisoning if he doesn’t get some rest, and because his experience is invaluable in this era of heroism.
  • His skills are so important because Ingenium was always known for his ability to cooperate with other heroes. He had dozens of sidekicks, and his team was always known for their ability to coordinate big scale operations together and work as a well oiled machine to ensure every case was solved in the fastest, cleanest way. They were also known to be able to cooperate very well with heroes they weren’t as familiar with, and produce great results. This skill is what made him fit to also substitute for All Might, who with all his power never really needed to work with a team. He had one sidekick at a time, and they were practically the only people he worked with. When you’re as powerful as All Might, you don’t usually need to team up with others.
  • Obviously, he starts studying education at the same time so he can become a full time teacher (also so he can be a better teacher at the moment).
  • He keeps it as a surprise from Tenya. He wants to see the look on his face when he gets into class for the first time.
  • First time Tensei rolls into class, with a shit eating grin on his face, and says “hello class, my name is Iida Tensei, and I’ll be your substitute teacher”, Tenya almost loses it. Tensei isn’t disappointed by the reaction.
  • The teacher’s lounge is never quiet again. Ever. The old gang is back and they are even louder with Tensei there. They all do their jobs, and do them perfectly, but there’s a lot more banter.
  • Cementoss really enjoys it. He was two years below them in school, and always kind of looked up to the four of them.

  • He keeps it as a surprise from Tenya. He wants to see the look on his face when he gets into class for the first time.
  • First time Tensei rolls into class, with a shit eating grin on his face, and says “hello class, my name is Iida Tensei, and I’ll be your substitute teacher”, Tenya almost loses it. Tensei isn’t disappointed by the reaction.
  • The teacher’s lounge is never quiet again. Ever. The old gang is back and they are even louder with Tensei there. They all do their jobs, and do them perfectly, but there’s a lot more banter.
  • Cementoss really enjoys it. He was two years below them in school, and always kind of looked up to the four of them.

summary: How would Sero and Denki feel about or comfort a s.o who has a pretty powerful quirk but feels insecure about it? Like they...
question: How would Sero and Denki feel about or comfort a s.o who has a pretty powerful quirk but feels insecure about it? Like they don’t want people to think of them as a rival, and they don’t really want to be the best but just want to be a hero, if that makes sense...
answer:
MM..BEST BOYS! I gotchu anon-chan! I hope it’s to your liking!^-^ -Calamari

Hanta Sero:

  • Hanta actually couldn’t tell that you were insecure about your quirk. Or at least.. not at first. It took him some observing and time with you for him to notice. 
  • He couldn’t quite figure out why exactly you’d be insecure about your quirk, especially considering how it was a quirk he personally thought was stellar.
  • He constantly reminds you that your quirk is great, but always in really subtle ways. He’s a bit shy about it, but he tries his best to make you feel better.
  • He is constantly trying to find ways to get you to compliment yourself. He’s even tried just straight up saying “Name 3 things you like about your quirk!”
  • He isn’t one to brag about your achievements but the moment he realizes you’re insecure about your quirks, he tries to find any excuse to talk about you and how great your quirk is.

Denki Kaminari:

  • Denki was absolutely in shock when he found out you weren’t the most enthusiastic about your quirk. 
  • He does understand what it’s like to feel that way though, and he instantly sympathizes with you. Sure, his quirk is big, flashy and strong, but it also has huge repercussions. 
  • He thinks your quirk is amazing though, and he will get into faux arguments with you over why you shouldn’t feel the way you do about your quirk.
  • He will 100 percent brag about you, especially when you’re feeling down. Anyone who so much as starts a conversation with him is getting an earful about how cool you are.

summary: A list of Quirks that 100% definitely exist in the world of My Hero Academia: You can touch the crosswalk button and it...
body:
A list of Quirks that 100% definitely exist in the world of My Hero Academia:

  • You can touch the crosswalk button and it immediately stops traffic for you to cross
  • You can recharge AAA batteries if you look at them hard enough
  • You can move things with your mind but only if those things are keys on a keyboard
  • You can do a perfect impression of any character as long as that character was voiced by Charles Martinet
  • You can actually use your fingers as a functioning phone like little kids do (discovered when a kid held their “phone” out to their mom and she actually heard a voice on the other end of the line)
  • You can blink and make chalkboards completely clean (but not whiteboards)
  • You can sing exactly like William Shatner (and only Shatner)
  • You can make perfect forgeries of any work, but instead of you copying the original, the original instead changes to look as if it had been in your personal style all along (and everyone remembers it looking like that)
  • You can breath underwater as long as you sing sea shanties the whole time

summary: for the villain mic au now i can't stop imagining something similar happening to them as what happens between catra and adora in...
question: for the villain mic au now i can't stop imagining something similar happening to them as what happens between catra and adora in one of the later episodes of she-ra. w/o spoilers they are both trapped together(in this au it can be in their mind) and are forced to watch their memories play out/while at the same time half reliving them. they don't get to choose the memories they just have to watch. SO MUCH angst potential for that. mic seeing shota being bullied shota seeing mic be muzzled SO MUCH
answer:
Oh my god… Anon, you have no idea how much I love mind bullshit - ESPECIALLY when it comes to things like memories and past trauma! I don’t watch She-Ra, but I know a tasty trope when I see one! 

Of course they would get hit by a quirk, especially in the later half of the story when Mic’s becoming more vigilante than villain, and of course both these idiots have a hero complex so they try to save each other. The villain’s quirk probably forces one’s body to shut down relieve their memories, but when two people get tagged at the same time, then they end up sharing a dream link that ends with both people seeing their own memories and the memories of another. Think how good a quirk that would’ve been for couple’s counseling! 

So now the two are in the hospital, which they’re unaware of, and trapped in a black space where they can only find each other. They’re not in their hero costumes, either. They’re dressed as their truest expression of self - for Aizawa this would be comfortable black clothing with his binding cloth around his neck. After so many years of having that cloth next to him, you can’t tell me that he doesn’t wear that thing at home and forget it’s there sometimes. 

Mic, though… Mic would be Yamada Hizashi. For Villain!Mic his truest expression would be clothes that are too big and too soft, clunky glasses that never seem to stay on right, a pair of headphones because what if what if what if and hair that’s only just half pulled back - he needs to hide his hearing aids, after all. If Aizawa didn’t know who his barista was by now, this helps him figure it out. 

After a very angst-filled conversation about cat muffins and “You’ve been in front of me this whole time?!” the two sees distant lights in the background and, well, might as well try to figure out where they are, right?

Cue the memories. I see them walking through a black background with only the lightest traces of some sort of road that they’re following, balls of light passing by them. Each one that bumps up against them throws them into a memory. They’re randomized - how could they not be? One mind full of memories is a lot, but two? Things are bound to get mixed up.

They see Aizawa Shota winning his first year sports festival, standing tall and proud as he’s told he’ll be pushed up into the U.A. hero course. 

They see Yamada Hizashi living on the streets when he’s sixteen because no one wanted him and where else was he supposed to go?

They see Eraserhead being rushed to the hospital, the Nomu leaving scars that are still healing - that will always be healing. 

They see a quiet Hizashi curled up in his apartment, holding his cat close and mumbling about how he had forgotten how to smile.

They see a loud Shota laughing with friends at a bar after finally, finally, finally being dragged out. 

Birthdays, and Christmases, and schoolyard brawls, and love, and hate, and every little thing in between - these two see glimpses of it all, and then… 

Hizashi sees a young Shota bullied and hated for his quirk. Why wouldn’t he be? No one likes the idea of not being special. No one likes the idea of being made quirkless. 

The memory fades and the two are left as they are, bruises long since forgotten and healed, and Shota is ready to tell him that, but instead he looks to see Hizashi is crying, hands covering his mouth. He can only mumble, so quietly, “You were like me.” 

Another ball of light comes speeding towards them and crashes right into Shota as if it had been trying to find him. They’re rocketed into a memory and this time Hizashi is crying for more reasons than one, hands over his mouth as he tries to be absolutely silent. Shota doesn’t get to ask what’s wrong before he finds out.

A young Hizashi, no younger than five, but no older than seven, is crying and sobbing and slipping with his quirk no matter how much he tries to stop it. When it finally does stop, a device is fitted around his face. It takes a moment for Shota to realize what it is because he cannot, no matter how hard he tries, figure out how anyone could justify forcing a child to wear a muzzle. 

The adult Hizashi beside him is utterly still and silent, as if afraid to make any type of noise. The child in front of him is the same. The woman - no, the villain - in front of them is cooing softly and there we go. All nice and silent. Isn’t that better, Hizashi?

The memory ends as soon as it began and there’s nothing but absolute silence between the two of them. 

Then, slowly, so, so, so slowly, Shota pulls Hizashi’s hands away from his mouth, holding tight when the man tries to jerk them away and it’s okay. He tells him that it’s okay. He can scream and cry as much as he wants. 

But what if he hurts someone?

He won’t. Shota will make sure of it.

Promise?

Promise. 

…

Goddammit now I have another story to write for this AU.

body:
So I just told someone I follow (whom I love omf; great shiggy content-) a present mic headcanon I had


Basically, He lost his voice permanently. And his amplifiers are his ‘voice box’. They detect the vibrations of the words he trying to say, and amplify them to the voice he chose (the one he speaks with yEAAAAAHHHHHH)


🤷🏼‍♀️ I just thought about it and yea. Seemed more interesting in my head frfr

summary: Thanks for the 300+ followers! I actually finished a piece! WHOO! (Here is the full version where you can see his peen~) I’ve...
caption:
Thanks for the 300+ followers! I actually finished a piece! WHOO!

(Here is the full version where you can see his peen~)

I’ve been drawing digital for about 4 months or so now, and I’m really proud of the progress I’ve made! I’ve got still a lot to learn and I keep experimenting things as I go, but fuck I’m proud of this. For the moment at least. Tomorrow I might already hate how this looks. 

AND THE WORLD NEED MORE YAGI IN LINGERIE, GODDAMNIT.
